direction.raw_text: She's violent, Mrs. Bishop. Look. Scout Master Ward shows Mrs. Bishop the blood all over his hands and uniform. Mrs. Bishop looks confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP I don't get it. Were there witnesses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. It's assault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP I beg your pardon. Are you a lawyer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, ma'am, but -- MRS. BISHOP (FURIOUS) Well, I am! Captain Sharp gently draws Mrs. Bishop away by the shoulder. He links arms with her as he tries to placate the group:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy does it. Calm down, Laura.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Stay away from my wife. Mr. Bishop pushes Captain Sharp away from Mrs. Bishop into Scout Master Ward. Scout Master Ward lunges at Mr. Bishop but is intercepted by Captain Sharp and Mrs. Bishop. They shout
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP SCOUT MASTER WARD/MRS. BISHOP Dammit! Christ! Shit! Jesus! At this moment, a voice interjects from the shore:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Excuse me! Excuse me! Excuse me, Captain Sharp? Captain Sharp, Scout Master Ward, and Mr. and Mrs. Bishop stop fighting and turn around at once. They see: the narrator. He stands at the foot of the dock holding a journal with rubber bands wrapped around it. They all stare at him blankly. He continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As some of you know, I taught Sam for the cartography Accomplishment Patch. He's a smart boy, and he expressed a keen interest in the history of the island's indigenous peoples. In particular, I recall his fascination with the idea of retracing the original path of the old Chickchaw harvest migration. Long pause. Everyone looks utterly perplexed. The propeller of the seaplane starts up, and they all shield their eyes from the blast of wind and dust. The narrator hesitates. He yells over the noise:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I'm getting at is this: I think I know where they're going. The narrator removes the rubber bands from his journal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A carefully hand-drafted nautical chart. A cove is marked with a red arrow and the caption Mile 3.25 Tidal Inlet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The portable record player. Suzy's fingers place the needle onto a spinning disc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A small cove enclosed by a low, rocky cliff. It forms an almost complete circle and is overgrown with vines, flowers, and branches. A thin channel leads out to the ocean. The sand on the shore is white, and the water is perfectly clear and crowded with shells at the bottom. Birds echo and fly from tree to tree. Sam's and Suzy's luggage is piled on the beach. The kitten wanders, exploring. The lid of the portable record player is open. The voice of Leonard Bernstein says over the speaker:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Onto the bird-house, where every kind of bird imaginable is whirling and wheeling around. This is a real acrobatic act for our gifted young flute player, Paula Robeson. As they listen, Sam and Suzy take off their shoes and socks and run in opposite directions around the edge of the cove. They each climb up a rock over the water. They look at each other across the lagoon. They both laugh. Suzy shouts,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is weird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know! Sam takes off his coon-skin cap and throws it aside. Suzy removes her cardigan and drops it on the ground. Sam strips off his uniform down to his white briefs. Suzy take off everything except her underwear and a training bra. They throw their clothes into the water. Sam yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On three! Suzy immediately counts very quickly. They both scream as they leap into the water. They swim toward each other, laughing and shouting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A clothesline hung with Sam's and Suzy's wet clothes swaying like flags and snapping in the wind. The tent has been pitched on a low, sandy plateau close to the water. Two lines of shells mark a path to the entrance. A long stick is jammed into the ground with a flickering safety-candle stuck into the Y at the top. The kitten is asleep. Sam sits on a folding stool in front of a portable easel. He dips his brush into a tin cup and paints. Suzy poses stretched out and propped up on one arm. She adjusts herself slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like it here, but I don't like the name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me, neither.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mile 3.25 Tidal Inlet. It's got no ring to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's change it. What should it be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me think for a minute. Sam continues to paint while Suzy thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A binocular shot of a deep blue, star-filled sky. Suzy lies on her back on a flat rock in the middle of the cove looking up into the night. Sam wades out to her and climbs up beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I made you some jewelry. Sam holds up two dead, shimmering, opalescent beetles with fish-hooks threaded into their shells. Suzy looks enchanted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are your ears pierced?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside the tent, lit by a lantern. Sam clenches his teeth as he forces one of the fish-hooks through Suzy's earlobe. Suzy screams murderously. Sam releases her. The beetle dangles neatly. A line of blood runs down the side of Suzy's neck. Sam holds up a little mirror. Suzy nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's pretty. Do the other one. Sam switches to Suzy's other earlobe. She resumes her screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam and Suzy standing on the beach listening to the French singer's record. They face each other, bobbing their heads and tilting awkwardly to the music. Suzy eventually begins to dance. Sam does something vaguely like the Twist. They press against each other and kiss. Suzy says quietly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It feels hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you mind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tilt your head sideways. Sam and Suzy kiss again. Sam pushes his hands through Suzy's hair and draws it back behind her ears. Suzy whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can touch my chest. Sam slides his hand up under the training bra and presses it onto Suzy's breast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're going to grow more. Sam nods. He looks to be in a trance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam and Suzy sitting on a tree branch over the water eating raisins from Sam's hand. Suzy has flowers in her hair. She looks down into the water with her binoculars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you always use binoculars? Suzy thinks for minute. She says finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It helps me see things closer. Even if they're not very far away. I pretend it's my magic power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds like poetry. Poems don't always have to rhyme, you know. They're just supposed to be creative. Suzy gives Sam the binoculars. He points them at her and stares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want to be? When you grow up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I want to go on adventures, I think. Not get stuck in one place. How about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on adventures, too. Not get stuck, too. I guess that sounds almost like I'm just repeating what you just said, but I couldn't think of anything as good as it. On the other hand, maybe we'll get blown up by an atom bomb. You can't predict the exact future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's possible I may wet the bed, by the way. Later, I mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I didn't have to mention it, but just in case. I don't want to make you be offended.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, I won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some people frown on these problems. Suzy nods. She holds Sam's hand. She points to the scorpion brooch pinned to Sam's shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that one for? Sam looks at the brooch. He shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not an accomplishment. I inherited it from my mother. It's actually not meant for a male to wear -- but I don't give a damn. Suzy nods thoughtfully. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are your foster parents still mad at you? For getting in trouble so much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so. We're getting to know each other better. I feel like I'm in a family now. Not like yours, but similar to one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always wished I was an orphan. Most of my favorite characters are. I think your lives are more special. Sam frowns. Tears suddenly well-up in his eyes. He shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, but you don't know what you're talking about. Long pause. Suzy says genuinely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A campfire burns in front of the tent. Sam lies on his back on one of the bedrolls smoking his pipe while Suzy sits Indian-style next to him. She reads aloud from a book called The Light of Seven Matchsticks. There is an illustration on the cover of a child's hand extinguishing a little flame. A ribbon of smoke curls between its fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The flashlight's beam drew a moon through the black across the attic and settled on a gap in the base-board. A mouse-hole, no bigger than a pocket-watch. Eric crouched on his flat feet and placed his hand in front of the tiny opening. "It's windy," he said. "Like someone in there's blowing on my fingers." Christy rolled her eyes and sighed a sigh. He's right again, she thought. Little brothers drive people crazy. Suzy looks to Sam to see if he is still awake. Sam nods and signals for Suzy to continue. Suzy turns the page and reads
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Part Two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next morning. Sam and Suzy are asleep with their arms wrapped around each other inside the tent. They wear only their underwear. The sound of an airplane approaches. Sam's eyes open. The noise buzzes by loudly overhead. Suzy sits up. Sam scrambles to his feet, unzips the flaps of the tent, and looks out. Suzy crouches beside him, holding onto his leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Sharp standing on the beach fifteen feet away. Scout Master Ward waits behind him with Gadge, Skotak, and Lazy- Eye. Mr. and Mrs. Bishop stride up out of the water. Mr. Bishop looks incensed. They are wet to the waist. The police launch is moored in the lagoon. Two larger boats with St. Jack Wood Fire Brigade printed on their hulls float further away. Men in red caps stand on their decks. Suzy pulls Sam back inside. She zips up the tent again. She kisses Sam. Mr. Bishop hollers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Suzy! Get out here! Mr. Bishop grabs hold of the entire tent by the top and rips it up out of the ground, uprooting the stakes which go flying. This reveals: Sam and Suzy, half-naked, entwined, kissing. Mr. and Mrs. Bishop both freeze. Sam and Suzy look up to them. Mr. Bishop growls and roars at them ferociously like a monster. Sam and Suzy look horrified. Mr. Bishop's face suddenly drains of all emotion. Pause. Mrs. Bishop commands Sam and Suzy:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Put your clothes on. Both of you. Sam and Suzy remain perfectly still. Mrs. Bishop grabs Suzy by the arm and jerks her to her feet. Sam and Suzy hang onto each other. Mrs. Bishop slaps Suzy with a whack. Sam lets go, and Suzy is gone. Scout Master Ward comes over to Sam sadly and hands him his uniform. Sam takes it. Scout Master Ward turns to the other scouts, claps his hands twice, and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strike this camp. Sam starts putting on his socks. Captain Sharp watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Captain Sharp drives his boat along the coast with a grim look on his face. Suzy rides in the back with Mr. and Mrs. Bishop. Sam rides in the front with the other scouts. An interrogation is in progress:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long were you planning to stay there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said ten days or less.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a lie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you ever think about what would happen next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not to my recollection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a traitor to our family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. I want to be. Scout Master Ward sits next to Captain Sharp. He shows him the air-mail envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do I do about this? Captain Sharp shrugs. He says, resigned:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give him his mail. Scout Master Ward turns to Sam. He holds out the envelope. Sam takes it. He opens it. He reads. Suzy watches him from across the boat. She calls out anxiously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does it say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They can't invite me back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gave them too much aggravation. Suzy stands up. She says as she starts across the boat:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me read it. Sam holds out the note. Mr. Bishop pulls Suzy back down to her seat. He stands up, himself, and walks over to Sam. He takes him by the wrist and leads him to a small cabin. He opens the door and presses him forward. Sam stumbles down the steps and looks back. Mr. Bishop shuts the door. Captain Sharp glares at him. Suzy says icily:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's child abuse. Mr. Bishop returns to the back of the boat and sits down again. He gives Suzy a direct order:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Be advised: the two of you will never see each other again. Those were your last words. Do you understand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be careful if I were you. One of these days somebody's going to be pushed too far, and who knows what they're capable of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (HESITATES) Is that a threat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a warning. Suzy looks from Captain Sharp to Mrs. Bishop and back to Mr. Bishop. Mr. Bishop falls silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I knew what makes you tick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (HESITATES) I beg your pardon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Please, terminate this conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (TO LIONEL) She's saying that to me? Lionel shakes his head bitterly. Suzy stares out to sea. Scout Master Ward walks over to the cabin, opens the door, and goes inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A small room with two bunks, two portholes, and a pile of ropes. Sam sits hunched over with his hands in his lap. He stares at the envelope. Scout Master Ward sits down across from him. He motions to the envelope and says quietly, pausing between each sentence:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry about this. I didn't know your situation. It's not on the register. How'd you lose your parents? I shouldn't ask that. Never mind. I wish we had time for an inspection back there. On the beach. I would've given you a "commendable". That was one of the best- pitched camp-sites I've ever seen. Honestly. Sam does not respond. Scout Master Ward asks in a wounded
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to be a Khaki Scout anymore? Sam shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Becky sits at the switchboard with her head-phones on. Captain Sharp and Scout Master Ward sit behind her wearing their own sets of head-phones. There is a click on the other end of the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Hello, Becky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judy, I have your person-to-person from New Penzance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Go ahead, New Penzance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Split-screen. On one side of the frame, we see Captain Sharp, Scout Master Ward, and Becky. On the other side, we see a fifty-year-old woman in a blue and white uniform pants-suit with a Salvation Army officer-style hat and a red ribbon tied in a bow around her neck. She is Social Services. She sits at a desk in a cinder block office. Guards and orderlies criss- cross in a bullet-proof window to a long, grey corridor behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? This is Captain Sharp. Social Services flips open a file-folder and picks up a ball- point pen. (She takes notes throughout the conversation.) She says into her telephone:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Captain Sharp. This is Social Services. I'm calling in reference to Sam Shakusky, Ward of the State. I understand he's in your custody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's correct.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's his condition? Has he suffered any injury or trauma of any kind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's OK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good. How do I get to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fastest way is by seaplane. Jed can bring you in with the mail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll come tomorrow morning, if that's acceptable to you. Is someone able to (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) provide reasonable care and nourishment for the boy until that time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that a yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good. I'll contact you again before the end of the day. Social Services starts to hang up the telephone. Captain Sharp says abruptly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Social Services?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Sharp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going to happen to him? Pause. Social Services puts down her pen. She clasps her hands together in front of her. She says finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, normally, we'd try to place him in another foster home, but that option is no longer available to us, in my opinion, with his case history -- which means he'll go to Juvenile Refuge. Captain Sharp exchanges a look with Scout Master Ward. Scout Master Ward interjects:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? An orphanage? Social Services frowns. She asks calmly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's speaking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Scout Master Ward. Social Services refers to a document in her file-folder. She nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. An orphanage -- but the first step is the admissions panel requires a psychological evaluation to determine whether or not the boy's a candidate for institutional treatment or electroshock therapy. Beyond that -- CAPTAIN SHARP (INTERRUPTING) Excuse me. Shock therapy? Why would that be necessary? He's not violent. Social Services picks up the document. She points to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The report describes an assault with scissors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was the girl! Who did that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, maybe she needs help, too -- but that's not our job. OK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OK. Social Service hangs up the telephone. Becky pulls the cords out of their sockets. Scout Master Ward looks to Captain Sharp. Silence. Becky opens a tin of home-made lemon bars. Captain Sharp declines one. Scout Master Ward tries one. He looks completely enchanted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The living room. There is a wicker rocking chair, a vase filled with wilted wildflowers, and a portrait of some
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Pilgrims hanging over a stone fireplace. Lionel, Murray, and Rudy sit together on the floor playing Parchesi. Mr. Bishop lurches into the doorway, shirtless. He carries an open bottle of red wine with a glass in one hand and a long- handled woodsman's axe in the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP I'll be out back. Lionel, Murray, and Lionel look up from their game. Mr. Bishop hesitates. He seems slightly disoriented.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP I'm going to find a tree to chop down. Mr. Bishop exits. Pause. Lionel rolls a pair of dice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Old linoleum floor. Dark curtainless window. One bare light bulb. Suzy sits erect in the bathtub staring blankly into space. Mrs. Bishop washes her with a soapy sponge. Suzy's clothes and leather folder are in the corner with the kitten scratching at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP I do know what you're feeling, Suzy-bean. I've had moments myself where I say: what am I doing here? Who made this decision? How could I allow myself to do something so stupid -- (WITH FEELING) -- and why is it still happening? We women are more emotional. You have to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suzy turns to Mrs. Bishop and interrupts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (HESITATES) Don't say "hate".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not? I mean it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP You think you mean it. In this moment. You're trying to hurt me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. (PAUSE) I know what you do with that sad, dumb police man. You go to bed with him. Mrs. Bishop looks stunned. She says quietly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP He's not dumb, but I guess he is kind of sad. Anyway, we shouldn't discuss that. It's not appropriate for me to even acknowledge what I already just said. Mrs. Bishop sees something sticking out of the leather folder. She pulls it out and stares at it. It is the "Coping with the Very Troubled Child" pamphlet. She looks to Suzy. Suzy looks away. Mrs. Bishop sighs deeply and says, on the verge of tears:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Poor Suzy. Why is everything so hard for you? Suzy starts to cry. She covers her face. Her voice breaks as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in love. We just want to be together. What's wrong with that? Mrs. Bishop puts her arms around Suzy. Suzy shakes, silently sobbing. Mrs. Bishop pulls some twigs and stems out of Suzy's hair. She studies the beetle earrings. She says wearily:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Oh, my God. How are we going to get these fish-hooks out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Captain Sharp cooks sausages on a skillet in a kitchenette. He has a bottle of beer in his hand. Sam sits waiting at a fold-out table with a glass of milk in front of him. He says without looking up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I admit we knew we'd get in trouble. That part's true. We knew people would be worried, and we still ran away, anyway -- but something also happened which we didn't do on purpose. When we first met each other. Something happened to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Captain Sharp stirs the sausages in the pan. He nods. He says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I agree with you. That's eloquent. I can't argue against anything you're saying -- but I don't have to, because you're twelve years old. Captain Sharp brings the skillet to the table and serves three links onto one plate and three onto another. He sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, let's face it, you're probably a much more intelligent person than I am. In fact, I guarantee it -- but even smart kids sometimes stick their fingers in electrical sockets, if you see what I mean. It takes time to figure things out. It's been proven by history: all mankind makes mistakes. It's our job to try to protect you from the dangerous ones. If we can. Captain Sharp pours an inch of beer into a glass and slides it over to Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want a slug? Sam nods. He and Captain Sharp both drink sips. Captain Sharp asks gently and sincerely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the rush? You've got your whole life in front of yourself. Ahead of you, I mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe so. Anyway, you're a bachelor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that have to do with it? So are you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's true. Did you love someone ever?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She didn't love me back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah. Sam considers this. Captain Sharp looks depressed. They start eating their sausages. Captain Sharp says quietly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry for your loss. Anyway, that's what people say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A drunk truck driver smashed into them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good grief. Silence. Captain Sharp refills both their beer glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Scout Master Ward sits on his cot in his pajamas again with a cigarette in his mouth. His tape recorder is recording. He says into the microphone:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scout Master's Log. September fourth. Scout Master Ward hesitates. He thinks for a minute. He takes a deep breath. He closes his eyes. He opens them again. He looks desperate. He looks up at the ceiling. He shakes his head. He presses stop. He kneels on the floor with his palms together and smokes. There is a slight commotion outside. Scout Master Ward
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stow it, out there! I want to hear some Z's!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The fort sixty feet above the camp. It is still under construction. The entire troop (with the exceptions of Redford and Sam) has gathered for a clandestine meeting. They all wear pajamas. Skotak stands on a balcony with his back to the group and his hands on a wooden railing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard he's going to reform school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard they're going to take out a piece of his brain and send him to an insane asylum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like his girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's too scruffy for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Supposedly, they got to third base.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not true. He just felt her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over-shirt or under-shirt? Skotak slams his fist on the railing. Everyone looks startled. Skotak turns around to face the group. He says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn us. The railing collapses behind Skotak, ripping part of a wall and a row of shingles off the structure as it falls away. There is a moment of silence before it hits the ground with a splintering thud. Skotak hesitates. He moves a half-step away from the edge. He continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This troop has been very shabby to Field Mate Sam Shakusky. In fact, we've been a bunch of mean jerks. Why's he so unpopular? I admit, supposedly, he's (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: emotionally disturbed -- but he's also a disadvantaged orphan. How would you feel? Skotak moves among the group, looking from face to face, as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nickleby? Deluca? Lazy-Eye? (from the heart) Gadge? Skotak circles around the edge of the tree house. He says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a fellow Khaki Scout, and he needs our help. Are we man enough to give that? So part of his brain doesn't get removed out of him. Skotak stands still. He says mysteriously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were prepared to die for each other out there. Silence. The other scouts begin to murmur to each other, shaking their heads, shrugging, whispering, and gesturing. Finally, Deluca looks up to Skotak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you need?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For starters? Three yards of chicken wire, some ripped-up newspapers, and a bucket of wheatpaste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT A thick tree has been chopped almost completely through its trunk. For some reason, it remains standing. Mr. Bishop sits on the ground leaning against it. He breathes heavily. The axe rests across his lap. A twig snaps. Mr. Bishop looks up, listening. Pause. He drinks a sip of wine. In the background, on the other side of the lawn, five small silhouettes run silently in a row away from the house into the trees on the left. A moment later, one taller silhouette rides a bicycle silently away from the house into the trees on the right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Captain Sharp sits on the hood of his station wagon. Mrs. Bishop leans against it with her bicycle in front of her. They smoke cigarettes. Captain Sharp says sadly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In other words, it's over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP I guess so. For the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until further notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP I've got to do better. For everybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Except me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Except you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I hope you can. I think you will. You're doing the right thing. Pause. Captain Sharp suddenly slides his hand inside Mrs. Bishop's shirt onto her breast and simultaneously kisses her
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then just as suddenly gets into his car and starts the engine. Mrs. Bishop hesitates. She reaches inside the window and puts her hand on the top of Captain Sharp's head. She says, worried:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Who know what's going to happen, Duffy? I'll probably see you tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you won't. Silence. The motor idles. Captain Sharp says distantly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I admire them, you know? There's a purity to it. I only feel bad because they both seem like such unhappy, lonely, miserable people -- but maybe that's romantic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (PUZZLED) I don't see it that way. Captain Sharp puts the car into gear and drives off. Mrs. Bishop finishes her cigarette. She gets on her bicycle and rides away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT A burning match drops down into the fireplace near the foot of a bunk where Sam lies sleeping. He has the sheet pulled up to his chin, but his toes stick out. He opens one eye. Dust descends and settles. Something scrapes and scratches. The flame burns out. Sam slides slowly off the mattress and creeps across the floor. He crouches in front of the fireplace. He flicks on a scout flashlight and sees: The end of a hanging rope. Sam leans quickly into the fireplace and looks straight up, shining his flashlight. Skotak is looking down at him from the top of the chimney. He puts his finger to his lips. Sam
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of my chimney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me. We're here for friendship. We're going to get you off this island.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, thanks. This is an emergency rescue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's worthless to me. There's no point. Not without Suzy. Skotak gestures for Sam to wait. He disappears from view. A moment later, Suzy's face appears at the top of the chimney, smiling toothily. Sam looks ecstatic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you get here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They snuck me down the laundry chute and left a paper-mache dummy in my bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diversion tactics. Good thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next room. Captain Sharp sleeps in boxer shorts on the floor of the kitchenette in the dark. He snores quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Five mini-canoes race across a wide, choppy strait close to the open sea. Skotak, Deluca, Nickleby, Gadge, Lazy-Eye, Panagle, Roosevelt, Chef, and Izod paddle aggressively. We hear in voice-over:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Where we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Fort Lebanon. My cousin Ben runs the Supply and Resources outpost for the Jubilee. He's a Falcon Scout, Legionnaire. Cousin Ben'll know what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Can we trust him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Normally, I'd say no. Sam and Suzy ride in the back of the canoe that Skotak rows. Sam has his arms around Suzy's waist. The kitten is on her shoulder. Sam sees the portable record player among Suzy's things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you leave another note for Lionel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not this time. He can't keep his trap shut. Besides, I'll probably never see him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pebble beach below high dunes. Large waves sweep into the shore. Spray blows through the air. There is a black lighthouse on a rocky point in the distance. The narrator stands at the water's edge holding a meteorologist's measuring stick. He braces himself against the gusting winds. He speaks to the camera:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the island of St. Jack Wood, extending far north from Land's End along the deep-water channel that leads to Broken Rock. A low flood-plain separates the beach from the town-ship above. A small but prosperous community. The narrator takes out a pocket barometer. He reads it. He
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The barometer reads twenty-seven inches and dropping. Strong winds, as you can see, already at twenty-two knots. (checks his watch) The time is now four thirty-five A.M. The narrator walks quickly out of the shot. The five canoes land on the beach with the tide. Sam, Suzy, Skotak, and the rest of the troop quickly jump out and drag the boats up the shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The room is black. Mr. and Mrs. Bishop lie in separate single beds side-by-side. They both stare at the ceiling. The windows rattle, the walls creak, and trees sway outside. Long pause. Mrs. Bishop whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Did you file the motion for continuance? Peabody vs. Henderson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP It was sustained.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (PAUSE) Did the judge consider your application for leniency? Rogers vs. Yentob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP He granted it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Great. Silence. Mrs. Bishop's voice breaks as she says quietly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP I'm sorry, Walt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP It's not your fault. Which injuries are you apologizing for? Specifically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Specifically? Whichever ones still hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (WISTFULLY) Half of those were self-inflicted. Mrs. Bishop shakes her head and smiles with tears on her face. A powerful blast of wind shakes the room. A night-light blinks. Mr. Bishop has a lump in his throat as he says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP I hope the roof flies off, and I get sucked up into space. You'll be better off without me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (SADLY) Stop feeling sorry for yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (PAINED) Why? Mr. and Mrs. Bishop look across at each other in the dark. Mrs. Bishop says desperately:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP We're all they've got, Walt. Mr. Bishop takes a deep breath. He says finally, with a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP It's not enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Flashlight and lantern flames flicker over the jagged walls. Skotak is curled in a blanket on a high rock. Gadge is tucked into a sleeping bag under a ledge. The troop nestle on rocks and ledges in bedrolls and sleeping bags all around the deep cavern. Sam lies on his back on one of the bedrolls smoking his pipe while Suzy sits Indian-style next to him. She reads aloud from a book called Annabelle's Midnight. There is an illustration on the cover of a blonde girl climbing out a window onto a trellis with fireflies circling around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but I'm not going," said Barnaby Jack. "I'm running away tonight for good, and this time I won't get caught." Annabelle whispered: "I'm coming with you." Her yellow hair, now brown at the roots, caught up in the wind and danced. Barnaby Jack took Annabelle's hand and pressed something into it the size of a jellybean. "Hide this in your socks, and be ready at midnight." Suzy looks to Sam to see if he is still awake. Sam looks to the rest of the troop to see if they are still awake. They all nod and signal for Suzy to continue. Suzy turns the page and reads on:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leapt out the window and landed in the fresh-fallen snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The next morning. Camp Ivanhoe. Scout Master Ward emerges from his tent. He puts on his hat. The wind whips it off his head. He chases it, catches it, and puts it back on with the chin-strap tight. He frowns. He shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No bugle? No reveille? Lazy-eye, Gadge, Deluca, Izod? Where's my troop? Let's go! You're late! Scout Master Ward tries to light a cigarette, but the match blows out. He walks past the latrine, the workbench, the row of smaller tents, and the charcoal grill. He throws his hands into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chef? Breakfast? Scout Master Ward shakes his head. He arrives at the picnic table and rings his bell. He sits down. He opens a new issue of Indian Corn. There is a picture on the cover of a scout troop rappelling in Tasmania. He struggles to keep the rippling pages from turning by themselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first page. There is another drawing of the Scout Master- in-Chief. This time he is behind the wheel of a ship. His signature below, once again, reads Commander Pierce. There is a quotation in large text: "Anyone can hold the helm when the sea is calm." Pause. Scout Master Ward lowers his magazine. He looks around, confused. Something dawns on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A small entourage of teenage scouts studies maps, charts, and documents at folding tables. One of them sits at a telegraph machine. He wears headphones and taps Morse code on a paddle as he listens to a transmission. He looks puzzled. He swivels his chair to a steno-machine and begins typing rapidly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A triple-sized tent with a canopy in front and a large totem pole looming over it. It stands on five-foot stilts. There is a school bus parked next to it with letters painted across its side which read Regional Jubilee. A forty-five-year-old scout master with several medals on his chest is sharpening a straight razor. He is Secretary McIntire. He adjusts a hot towel on the face of a man in a barber's chair. The young telegraph operator hurries out of the tent carrying a strip of paper. He hands it to Secretary McIntire. Secretary McIntire stares at it. He says to the man under the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not going to believe this one, sir. That Scout Master on New Penzance? Has now lost his entire troop. The seated man whips the towel off his face and rises to his feet. He is Commander Pierce himself. He has silver hair, a moustache, and a much greater number of medals. He says in disbelief as he snatches the slip of paper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'll be damned. Who is this bimbo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't say. Commander Pierce shakes his head. He continues to study the document as he sits back down. Secretary McIntire begins to lather his cheeks with a brush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A vast archway of wood, straw, and rope construction. Fort Lebanon is spelled out across the top with bound sticks. A large flag waving madly on a pole reads Khaki Scouts of North America. A bugler on a platform plays the familiar staccato tattoo. It echoes for miles. Sam and Suzy wait inside the gates crouched behind a row of trash cans with the rest of the troop except Skotak. They shiver. Sam has on his back-pack. Suzy carries her suitcase. Gadge holds a tennis ball can. A scout master in an Indian chief's headdress stops as he walks by. He looks curiously at Sam and especially Suzy. He says to Nickleby:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's your unit leader? Pause. Nickleby points to a fat man in an apron cooking hamburgers on a grill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That guy. The scout master shrugs. Skotak comes over and says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a broken gum-ball machine behind the snack tent. Skotak distributes a handful of gum-balls among Sam, Suzy, and the rest of the troop. They all put them in their mouths. Skotak motions for everyone to follow him. A footbridge across a stream leads to a Quonset hut with an awning in front labelled Supply Tent. A crowd of very young scouts waits at a wide counter bartering over boxes of food, drink, and equipment. A team of helpers collects money and packages goods. At the center, there is a twenty-year-old
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . scout with a pencil behind his ear. He is Cousin Ben. He says to a nine-year-old Junior Khaki:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care how they do it where you come from. You want pop? You want candy? You want a snake-bite kit? Get some money. Skotak appears and whispers something to Cousin Ben. Cousin Ben nods. He says to his customers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come back in five minutes. Cousin Ben pulls a curtain shut behind the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Sam, Suzy, Skotak and the rest of the troop follow Cousin Ben briskly out a door and onto a cat-walk that runs along the top of a wall made from tall, pointed logs. As they talk, they walk past dozens of rows and clusters of tents grouped by color in the fields below. They walk past towers, huts, ladders, latrines, and a catapult under construction. They walk past a white infirmary with a red cross on it and a doctor taking a boy's blood pressure. They walk past a fleet of small, antique sailboats flying assorted troop banners. Five hundred scouts and fifty scout masters work, eat, talk, cook, and play sports and games all around the compound in spite of the fierce winds. One group rides motorcycles, another fires model rockets, another flies by overhead on a cable-trolley. Cousin Ben points to Sam and asks Skotak over the sound of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Field Mate Sam Shakusky, Troop 55, resigned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's hot. Almost too hot. What's in the can?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seventy-six dollars -- but it's mostly in nickels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Skotak motions for Gadge to hand Cousin Ben the tennis ball can. It appears to be very heavy and jingles as it moves. Cousin Ben takes it. He says to Sam:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You badge in seamanship?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. Sam points to one of the patches on his sash. It has an anchor embroidered on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. There's cold-water crabber moored off Broken Rock. The skipper owes me an I.O.U. We'll see if he can take you on as a claw cracker. It won't be an easy life, but it's better than shock therapy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir. By the way, where's the chapel tent? Cousin Ben hesitates. He points behind them with his thumb:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back there, but the padre's home with the mumps. Why do you ask?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to bring my wife. Cousin Ben stops walking. He looks Sam up and down. Suzy says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we're not married yet. Cousin Ben turns to Suzy. He looks back to Sam and back to Suzy again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You his girl? Suzy nods. Cousin Ben looks intrigued. He says tentatively:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Technically, I'm a civil-law scrivener. I'm authorized to declare births, deaths, and marriages. You're kind of young. You got a license?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sam and Suzy shake their heads. Cousin Ben nods. He speaks more gently now:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't offer you a legally binding union. It won't hold up in the state, the county, or, frankly, any courtroom in the world due to your age, lack of a license, and failure to get parental consent -- but the ritual does carry a very important moral weight within yourselves. You can't enter into this lightly. Do you love each other? Sam and Suzy immediately nod. Cousin Ben continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure you're ready for this? Sam and Suzy immediately nod. Cousin Ben looks perturbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me rephrase it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in a hurry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spit out the gum, sister. In fact, everybody. Cousin Ben puts out his hand. Suzy spits her gum into his palm. He throws it away over his shoulder. Sam and the rest of the troop spit their gum out on the ground. Cousin Ben
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like the snappy attitude. This is the most important decision you've made in your lives. Now go over by that trampoline and talk it through before you give me another quick answer. Cousin Ben watches as Sam and Suzy walk away and stand next to a large trampoline. A small scout jumps from a high ladder, bounces, and does a back-flip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam and Suzy uncertain how to begin the conversation. Sam shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess we better try to pretend we're struggling over our decision for a minute before we go back over there and tell him -- SUZY Maybe he's right. It could be a mistake. Sam looks stunned. He is speechless. He stammers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Why? How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being married. Sometimes it seems sad to me. It might be better to just go steady permanently. Sam shakes his head. He looks off into the distance. He says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cousin Ben counting nickels in the tennis ball can. He jerks his thumb toward Sam and Suzy and says dismissively:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess they're probably just trying to pretend they're struggling over their decision, but at least -- SKOTAK Woah! Cousin Ben looks. Suzy has her hands around Sam's throat and is throttling him. Sam squirms loose and calms her down. The troop watches transfixed. Sam takes a snapshot out of his pocket and shows it to Suzy, explaining. Suzy nods. They come back over to the group. There are tears on Suzy's cheeks. She says to Cousin Ben:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Let's do a blood test.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Cousin Ben stands at a collapsible altar. He wears a purple, silk stole around his neck with crosses stitched into it. Sam
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . and Suzy hold a Bible with their hands on it. Skotak and the rest of troop listen solemnly as Cousin Ben reads from a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which we hereby consecrate on this day, the fifth of September, 1965. (LOOKING UP) That's the end of the short-form. Do any of the witnesses have objections or remarks? Usually, they don't. Skotak raises his hand. Cousin Ben reluctantly calls on him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skotak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we loan them the nickels? I'm worried about their future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my fee. Skotak and the rest of the troop look very concerned. They murmur to each other:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going to happen to them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's take a vote.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All in favor -- COUSIN BEN (LOUDLY) That's my fee. Skotak and the rest of the troop look to Cousin Ben. Cousin Ben glares at them. He sighs. He points to Skotak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just like your brothers. OK, give them the tennis ball can. Cousin Ben points to the tennis ball can on the floor next to his feet. Skotak takes it and zips it into a side-pocket of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sam's back-pack. Cousin Ben hands Sam and Suzy a receipt on a clipboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sign here -- and initial here and here. Sam and Suzy sign and initial. Cousin Ben tears out a copy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take the carbon. Leave the Bible. Let's go. Sam and Suzy turn and walk out of the chapel tent holding hands. They do not smile. Cousin Ben, Skotak, and the rest of the troop follow them with grave expressions on their faces. Sam touches Suzy's hair. Suzy kisses Sam's hand. They walk as a group through the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMP MARINA. DAY Sam, Suzy, Skotak, and the rest of the troop wait at the end of a narrow dock. Cousin Ben stands below them in a small sailboat. He reaches up to Suzy and lifts her onboard. He reaches up to Sam and lifts him onboard, too. He rigs the sail. Sam smiles sadly. He and Skotak do the secret handshake. The others quickly join in. Suzy blows them a kiss. Everyone looks choked up. Cousin Ben unloops a line. The sails quickly catch the strong wind, and the boat sails away into the harbor. Skotak and the rest of troop wave and salute. They watch, bittersweet. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where they going again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's going to work on a shrimper, if I understand correctly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish them well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me, too. Me, too. Skotak sighs. He turns and starts up the dock. The others follow him. Roosevelt hesitates. He points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think they're coming back. Skotak and the rest of the troop stop and turn around. The sailboat glides back in. Sam leaps onto the dock with the tennis ball can. Suzy looks worried. Cousin Ben yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be quick, sailor!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She left her binoculars on a hook in the chapel tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just leave them. Sam sprints up the dock. He yells back over his shoulder:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't. It's her magic power!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A binocular shot of Sam running full-speed through the compound. He approaches quickly -- then skids to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Redford blocks the entrance. He is dressed in white hospital pajamas with a red cross on the breast pocket. His side is heavily bandaged and his arm is attached to an I/V drip. He lowers Suzy's binoculars. Sam stands frozen in front of Redford. Redford stares at him icily. Sam starts to say something -- then pauses. He says,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You killed your dog, by the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snoopy? (SHRUGS) Well, it couldn't be helped. Sam nods. He asks quietly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you consider me your enemy? Redford frowns. He says in disbelief:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because your girlfriend stabbed me in the back with lefty scissors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's my wife now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm saying before that. Six weeks ago. From day one. What'd I do wrong? I'm trying to understand. (IN SUMMATION) Why don't you like me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should I? Nobody else does. Sam runs up to Redford and pokes him as hard as he can in the scissor cut with his finger. Redford screams. Scouts and scout masters everywhere stop what they are doing and look to the chapel tent. Across the compound, Commander Pierce comes out of his tent, alerted. Sam whips the binoculars out of Redford's hands, turns away, and sprints. No one moves anywhere except Sam dashing toward the marina. Redford shouts at the top of his lungs:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's here! The fugitive! Stop him! An emergency alarm sounds. The entire camp swings into action. Two teams of scouts playing capture-the-flag descend from both sides and cut Sam off from the dock. They wear red and yellow jerseys over their uniforms. Suzy jumps out of the boat onto the dock. Sam sees her beyond the blockade of scouts. She waves her arms. Sam throws up his hands. He sprints in a new direction, onto a wide field. There is a small, pink flag on a thin stick stuck in the ground at the center of a plastic ring. Sam grabs it as he runs past. He looks back and sees:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A mob of fifty scouts chasing him. He circles in a giant figure eight trailed by the huge group. He races up a hill and stops at the top. Sam looks down at the approaching scouts and hundreds of others watching. A dark cloud rolls in casting a giant shadow over the entire camp. Sam throws the little flag down at his pursuers like a javelin. It sails in an arc and pokes down into the grass. There is a thunderclap. Sam looks up into the sky. A bolt of lightning strikes him. Sam is thrown ten feet through the air and lands on his back. The tennis ball can explodes nickels. The mob of scouts stops with a jolt. They look terrified. Sam sits up. He is covered in black soot. His shoes are on fire. He shakes them off his feet. Suzy runs through the crowd of scouts and drops down on her knees in front of Sam. She looks astonished. Sam says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm OK. Suzy helps Sam to his feet. Sam raises Suzy's smoldering binoculars to his eyes. Skotak and the rest of the troop join them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A binocular shot of a ladder leaning against a high fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Follow me! Sam leads Suzy, Skotak, and the rest of the troop fly at a sprint to the fence, climb the ladder, and pull it up after them. A bugle plays a cavalry charge. The mob bolts after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Split-screen. On one side of the frame, we see Captain Sharp, Scout Master Ward, and Becky wearing their operator head- phones. On the other side, we see Commander Pierce, Secretary McIntire, and the commander's entourage inside the command tent. Commander Pierce says into his field-telephone:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Sharp, we've located the missing troop. They just fled camp. We're in (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) pursuit. They're accompanied by a twelve- year-old girl in knee-socks and Sunday- school shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand by, Commander Pierce. Captain Sharp spins around in his chair and flips a switch on a two-way radio. He says into a microphone:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jed, re-route to St. Jack Wood. Tell Social Services the boy's been spotted at Fort Lebanon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Roger that. Will comply. Captain Sharp sets down the microphone. He turns to Becky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Becky, notify the Bishops: Suzy's there. Becky nods. Captain Sharp turns to Scout Master Ward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Randy? You monitoring? Scout Master Ward is already on his feet. He peels off his head-phones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Affirmative. I'm on my way. Becky plugs a cord into a socket and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello! Mr. Bishop? Captain Sharp looks out the window with a sense of dread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Mr. Bishop listens on the telephone with a strained look on his face. Mrs. Bishop watches him intently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Oh, dear God. Mr. Bishop grabs Mrs. Bishop by the wrist. He says grimly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Get the boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mrs. Bishop raises her megaphone to her mouth. She shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Let's go! Right now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A deHavilland Beaver in heavy rain and turbulence. Jed speaks into his radio while piloting the aircraft. Social Services sits beside him in the passenger's seat. She looks queasy but determined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tower control, this is Jed. Confirm co- ordinates for new destination: alpha-two- two-seven-one-fiver. Looking pretty soupy up here. Wouldn't mind setting down before the pot boils over. (to Social Services) Hang on, Social Services. Jed presses the yoke forward, and the plane dips hard. Social Services braces against the dash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Scout Master Ward steers his outboard through the open channel. The boat crests high over deep swells, flooding over in waves. Scout Master Ward is drenched. He does not flinch or even appear to notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY Sam, Suzy, Skotak, and the rest of the troop scramble through the woods as fast as they can. There are flashes of lightning and pounding thunder. Suzy trips on a root, and Sam pulls her to her feet. Sam trips on a rock, and Suzy pulls him to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The commander's entourage is frantically packing up their portable telephones, P.A. system, folding tables, collapsible chairs, etc. One of them wraps a tarp around boxes labelled Fireworks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A transistor radio. The announcer says urgently:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Once again: storm waters have just breached the dam at Black Beacon (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (cont'd) Reservoir. A flash flood alert is in effect. Take immediate precautions. Commander Pierce and Secretary McIntire listen to the report. Secretary McIntire says gravely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's coming our way. Captain Pierce nods, worried. The capture-the-flag scouts in soaking jerseys gather, winded, outside the tent. One of the team captains stands in the entrance breathing heavily. Commander Pierce points to him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You find them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the entourage) Prepare to mobilize to higher ground. Secretary McIntire hands Commander Pierce an envelope with red-and-white stripes on it. Commander Pierce rips it open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: St. Jack Church is the designated storm shelter. (to Secretary McIntire) Notify all scouts to muster outside my tent on the double.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The St. Jack's Church poster box. Another mimeographed page is stapled to the bulletin board. The heading is now Summer Pageant, 1965. It reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Performed by the Choristers of St. Jack Wood and New Penzance
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EPISCOPAL CHURCH. DAY The set for the ark stands on the platform behind the altar. There are candles and garlands in place, but also stacks of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . cardboard boxes and gallons of distilled-water. Numerous animal costumes hang from a rolling garment rack. An old nun crosses the aisle carrying a large, metal coffee dispenser. Two young priests cross in the opposite direction carrying folding cots. Voices shout urgently off-screen:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) More sandbags! We need dry blankets! Wake up the Deacon! Sam, Suzy, Skotak, and the rest of the troop slowly poke their heads in from the side door and creep up the stairs to the choir loft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The entire brigade of scouts stands assembled in formation in the rain. The last two stragglers come running and hurry into their positions. They all wear rain slickers or canvas ponchos. Commander Pierce, Secretary McIntire, and the commander's entourage emerge quickly from the command tent. Commander Pierce shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attention, company! Prepare for -- Commander Pierce hesitates. He points down to the marina and says to Secretary McIntire:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's that? Secretary McIntire and the commander's entourage turn to see: Scout Master Ward speeding toward the dock in his motorboat. He leaps to shore, throws a line over a post, and sprints up to the assembly. He salutes Commander Pierce. Commander Pierce frowns and asks with quiet ferocity:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You call yourself a Khaki Scout?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's your goddamn troop? They could get killed out there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a liability to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The incident may affect our insurance premiums. Commander Pierce looks at Scout Master Ward's breast pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A name-tag that reads Scout Master Ward next to a patch with a picture of a snow-capped mountain. It says K.S.N.A. Leadership underneath. Commander Pierce says bitterly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm field-stripping you of your command. Commander Pierce rips the patch off Scout Master Ward's uniform and throws it aside. He holds out his hand, palm up. Scout Master Ward looks stricken. He reaches into his pocket, takes out his scout pocket-knife, and hands it Commander Pierce. Commander Pierce puts it into his own pocket. He
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attention, company! Prepare for emergency evacuation! Secretary McIntire leans close to Commander Pierce. He
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, do you have your medicine? Commander Pierce hesitates. He holds up a finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be right back. Commander Pierce strides back into the command tent. Secretary McIntire looks to Scout Master Ward, uneasy. Scout Master Ward stares down at the ground. The flash-flood explodes out from the woods. Gushing water pours down the hillside, cuts a swath through the center of the camp, and tears down everything in its narrow path. The command tent suddenly becomes a tiny island at the center of a rushing river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The company is taken aback. Scout Master Ward stiffens, watchful. The totem pole creaks and sways, then falls cleanly onto the command tent, splitting it down the middle. Inside, something sparks, pops, then blows up. The tent bursts into flames. Secretary McIntire does not react. He stands perfectly still, watching the fire. Scout Master Ward taps him, grabs him, and shakes him. Secretary McIntire looks at him blankly. Scout Master Ward makes a snap decision. He turns to the company
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold your position! Scout Master Ward runs ahead, splashes into the raging flood, wades through it against the current, dodging branches and debris, then pulls himself up onto the fallen totem pole and walks balancing on it to the burning tent. He disappears inside. Secretary McIntire and the vast company watch, riveted. Scout Master Ward comes out the opposite side of the tent onto the other end of the fallen totem pole carrying Commander Pierce over his shoulders. He descends back into the water, trudges through it, and steps up onto the embankment. The company looks deeply, permanently impressed. Scout Master Ward hollers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Company Secretary! Status report, sir! Secretary McIntire hesitates. He stirs to attention and says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All accounted for, Scout Master!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Supply and Resources! Call it out! Cousin Ben gives an A-OK sign near the front of the assembly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Affirmative, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fall in! We're going to run for it, boys! Let's move! The entire company follows Scout Master Ward with Commander Pierce over his shoulders at a fast jog out of the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY The room has now been converted into a full-fledged refugee center. Families from the town-ship huddle in pews with bags and piles of their wet belongings. Priests and nuns distribute towels and sandwiches to frightened children. Dogs and cats prowl nervously. Sandbags are stacked in low walls outside the doors and windows. The rain beats on the roof, and lightning continues to flash through the stained glass. A side door opens. Captain Sharp comes in from the storm with Mr. and Mrs. Bishop. Lionel, Murray, Rudy, and the two old fishermen follow closely behind them. They slam the door. Captain Sharp looks around frantically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's in charge here? Another side door opens. Scout Master Ward jogs in with Commander Pierce still over his shoulders and the entire company behind him flooding into the room. Captain Sharp yells to him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Randy! What happened? Scout Master Ward goes over to Captain Sharp and turns his back to him, jogging in place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take the commander off of me. Captain Sharp helps Commander Pierce down off Scout Master Ward's back and into a pew to rest. Secretary McIntire assists them. Mr. Bishop strides up the aisle yelling to the left and right:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Suzy? Sam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking his head) They ran away again. Mr. and Mrs. Bishop grimace, unbelievably frustrated. Scout Master Ward addresses the scouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going back out. I need volunteers. Hands raise. Scout Master Ward passes out walkie-talkies as he chooses his squad:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You, you, you, you -- Becky steps in front of Scout Master Ward with her hand raised. Scout Master Ward hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and you? Becky takes a walkie-talkie. She looks at Scout Master Ward with admiration and asks, concerned:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, I am. Come on. Scout Master Ward leads Becky by the arm through the crowded church as they begin to gather supplies: extra flashlights, a flare gun, coils of rope. Captain Sharp looks up to the choir loft. Eleven children dressed in animal masks sit quietly in a row. Captain Sharp does a double-take. One of the animals is an otter wearing Sunday-school shoes and binoculars around its neck. Next to her is the male of the species in a sash with numerous small, embroidered patches on it. The front doors open. There is lightning, thunder, wind, and rain. Social Services enters. She takes off a wet cape with a red lining and hands it to an acolyte in a robe. Jed presses the doors shut behind them. Social Services asks immediately:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the boy? Captain Sharp hesitates. He says reluctantly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not acceptable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pretending to be irritated) What do you want me to say, lady? (to no one in particular) Somebody get Jed a cup of coffee. The acolyte runs to the coffee dispenser with a cardboard cup. Social Services charges over to Captain Sharp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Captain Sharp?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Social Services. I remanded the boy to your personal custody. You're responsible for his safety. I'm told he was just struck by lightning. Captain Sharp frowns. He looks to Scout Master Ward and says
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the first I heard of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's true. Captain Sharp tries to process this. Social Services now moves in on Scout Master Ward. She says aggressively:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scout Master Ward, I presume?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your reputation precedes you. Captain Sharp and Scout Master Ward stand side-by-side in front of Social Services. She berates them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You two are the most appallingly incompetent custodial guardians Social Services has ever had the misfortune to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- in a twenty-seven year career! Captain Sharp and Scout Master Ward look sheepish. Social Services says bitterly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you have to say for yourselves? Captain Sharp hesitates. He says strangely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't do this. They'll eat him alive in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (aside, to Scout Master Ward) What's the name of the place again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juvenile refuge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juvenile refuge. That sounds like jail. Silence. In the background, the acolyte picks up Panagle's walking stick weapon off the floor. He stares at it, puzzled. Social Services says carefully:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just find the boy -- and deliver him -- (motioning to herself)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to Social Services. Nothing else is in your power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (SHARPLY) I'm sorry. Social Services, Captain Sharp, and Scout Master Ward turn to Mr. and Mrs. Bishop. Mr. Bishop looks tense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP Can we get back to the rescue now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (URGENTLY) Suzy's still out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walt and Laura Bishop. Their daughter's the missing girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The parents of the stabber?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP I object to that description. She was attacked. Commander Pierce appears with an oxygen mask over his face. He pulls it aside briefly and says to Secretary McIntire:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want the details. Where's the scout she knifed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right here. Secretary McIntire snaps his fingers and gives a signal. Redford appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Field Mate Redford, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (through the oxygen mask) What's his condition?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He may suffer some limited chronic kidney insufficiency. Here's the report. Secretary McIntire hands Commander Pierce a doctor's report. Mrs. Bishop snatches it and throws it over her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP We don't have time for this!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's right!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go! Social Services turns and starts up the aisle. She stops suddenly. Captain Sharp is standing in their path brandishing Panagle's walking stick weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody's going anywhere. Everyone stops. Captain Sharp locks eyes with Social Services. He says in a steely voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not getting shock therapy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Social Services looks furious. Her jaw sets. She reaches inside her jacket and withdraws a small pad labelled Citation Book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it! I'm citing you for gross misconduct! You are hereby summoned to appear before the board of -- Captain Sharp looks enraged. He grits his teeth. He reaches into his back pocket and withdraws a similar pad labelled Boating Violations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm writing you up back! Be notified that you stand accused of the mistreatment and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't let you do it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look! Everyone looks. Redford is standing on a pew with his arm stretched out pointing up at the choir loft in amazement. The troop is there, but Sam's and Suzy's seats are empty. There is a flash, a bang, and all the lights in the room go out at once. People gasp. Candles flicker alight on candlesticks. A back-up generator kicks into gear, humming, and the room fills with a new, different light. Captain Sharp says to himself:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (CONFUSED) Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP (UNCERTAIN) Suzy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gadge! Lazy-eye! Skotak!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're here? Captain Sharp strides down the aisle. He shouts up to Skotak:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd they go? Answer me! Skotak hesitates. He and the rest of the troop all look up to a small, rickety, attic door. It is slightly ajar above a long, narrow ladder behind the pipes of the organ. Captain Sharp bolts up the steps. Everyone follows him, running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The storm rages. Captain Sharp opens a trap door onto the high eaves. Faces appear in numerous windows below, looking up. Mr. and Mrs. Bishop poke their heads out behind Captain Sharp. On the far end of the rooftop, Sam and Suzy huddle together at the base of the high steeple.
